title: 115_hr1332
content:
The "Early Childhood Nutrition Improvement Act" establishes eligibility certification criteria for proprietary child care centers under the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act. The eligibility determination for these centers will be in effect for 6 months after approval by the State. Additionally, the Act includes a review of the serious deficiency process. Section 17(d)(5) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to include a serious deficiency process review by the Secretary within 1 year of enactment. This review will focus on determining serious deficiencies and related processes. The serious deficiency process review by the Secretary will focus on measures resulting in a finding of serious deficiency and differentiation between various factors. The serious deficiency process review by the Secretary will focus on measures resulting in a finding of serious deficiency, including a margin of human error, noncompliance, State-specific requirements, and Federal regulations. The curr_chunk focuses on appealing, mediating, determining corrective action plans, and termination/disqualification in cases of serious deficiency. The curr_chunk discusses the Secretary issuing guidance and regulations based on findings to ensure fair and effective administration of the serious deficiency process. The Secretary will issue guidance and regulations to clarify measures for noncompliance, appeals processes, and timeframes under corrective action plans in the serious deficiency process. The Secretary will issue guidance and regulations to clarify measures for noncompliance, appeals processes, and timeframes under a corrective action plan for all types of institutions. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF REIMBURSEMENTS FOR ADDITIONAL MEAL OR SNACK. Section 17(f)(2) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to limit reimbursements for meals and supplements per child per day. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act limits reimbursements for meals and supplements to 2 per child per day in child care settings exceeding 8 hours. SEC. 5. ADJUSTMENTS.

Amends the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act by changing the Consumer Price Index for food at home to the Consumer Price Index for food away from home.

SEC. 6. ADVISORY COMMITTEE ON PAPERWORK REDUCTION. The Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to establish an Advisory Committee on Paperwork Reduction to examine reducing unnecessary paperwork resulting from regulations and recordkeeping requirements. The Advisory Committee on Paperwork Reduction will provide recommendations to reduce paperwork for participants in the program while maintaining program integrity. It will be composed of members representing various entities such as public nonprofit centers, private nonprofit centers, family or group day care homes, Head Start centers, and for-profit centers. The Advisory Committee on Paperwork Reduction will consider recommendations from various entities such as Head Start centers, for-profit centers, emergency shelters, adult day care centers, State agencies, sponsoring organizations, anti-hunger advocacy organizations, at-risk after school programs, and child care advocacy organizations. They will also consider information from the Paperwork Reduction Work Group established by the Food and Nutrition Service. The Secretary will issue guidance and regulations within 2 years to streamline paperwork and recordkeeping requirements for the Child Nutrition and WIC Reauthorization Act of 2004, including reducing paperwork for applications and monitoring. A report must be issued within 180 days after the guidance and regulations are issued. The Secretary will issue guidance and regulations to streamline paperwork and recordkeeping requirements for the Child Nutrition and WIC Reauthorization Act of 2004. A report containing specific information must be submitted to the Senate and House committees within 180 days after the issuance of the guidance and regulations. The report will include explanations for not implementing Advisory Committee recommendations and recommendations for legislative action to strengthen and streamline program applications. The Secretary will issue guidance and regulations to streamline paperwork and recordkeeping requirements for the Child Nutrition and WIC Reauthorization Act of 2004, aiming to reduce administrative burdens on grantees and governments.
